image.altText: A Nauru Airlines plane on the tarmac at Broome Airport, viewed through a cyclone fence with a staircase attached,

props.synopsis: Another group of foreign nationals turn up in Western Australia's remote north, following the discovery of around two dozen men near the tiny Indigenous community of Beagle Bay on Friday morning.

title.children: New group of suspected asylum seekers found in WA's north, taking total number to more than 35

image.altText: Albanese addressing reps chamber alongside border force officials at a school with asylum seekers.

props.synopsis: The PM accuses the federal opposition of undermining Australia's border protection regime, arguing its rhetoric is fuelling the illegal people smuggling trade.

title.children: Albanese accuses Dutton of talking down tough border protection regime

image.altText: Alexei Navalny sits in a hospital bed in a medical gown surrounded by three people in protective gowns, masks and hair nets

props.synopsis: Alexei Navalny's suspicious death in a penal colony leaves Vladimir Putin largely unopposed in Russia's political landscape. Some fear no-one will be able to take the 47-year-old's place.

title.children: Even from prison, the 'president Russia never got' had an impact on politics. Now he's paid the price

image.altText: A man in a blue polo shirt with scars on his neck from being intubated.

props.synopsis: Jailed Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, one of the president's most vocal critics, has died, according to the prison service of the region where he had been serving a lengthy sentence.

title.children: Critics point finger at Vladimir Putin as Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny dies in jail, aged 47

image.altText: A brown snake caught in a web by a redback spider

props.synopsis: They may be one of Australia's most deadly animals but Peter Marchal says it is not the first time he has seen a redback spider triumph against an eastern brown snake.

title.children: Redback spider catches baby eastern brown snake in its web

image.altText: A jetty reaches towards the horizon with a spectacular golden sunset behind it.

props.synopsis: The scrapped Cashless Debit Card has left a divisive legacy in the South Australian coastal town of Ceduna, which is facing a rise in crime and antisocial behaviour.

title.children: Ceduna is the jewel of the Nullarbor but residents fear crime is tarnishing its reputation

image.altText: Skin of a patient after three days of measles infection.

props.synopsis: Health authorities have warned travellers on a flight from Melbourne to Adelaide to be alert for symptoms after a toddler has contracted measles.

title.children: Traveller alert after one-year-old in Adelaide reported with measles

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court and looks straight ahead. The gallery behind him is full of people.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is issued a staggering fine of $US354.9 million, which could deal a major blow to the former president's brand, bank balance and business empire. Here's why.

title.children: What is a 'scorched earth defence' and why did it backfire for Trump? Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Close up of Taylor Swift looking serious on stage in sparkly bodysuit

props.synopsis: There is a hum in the air from the start, a feeling that everyone in the city is tilting their bodies slightly towards the MCG, just waiting for the moment when she will finally take the stage.

title.children: Sparkles, sing-alongs and surprise tracks: Taylor Swift starts the Australian leg of her Eras tour with a bang

image.altText: Australia bowler Alana King throws a ball in the air after winning a Test against South Africa.

props.synopsis: Australia beats South Africa by an innings and 284 runs in the West Test at the WACA, wrapping up their multi-format series.

title.children: Australia completes thumping Test win over South Africa

image.altText: A body camera shot of a person holding a gun aimed at a tower.

props.synopsis: The timing is critical as Russia is looking for a morale boost ahead of the second anniversary on February 24 of Moscow's full-scale invasion of Ukraine and the March presidential election in Russia.

title.children: Ukraine withdraws beleaguered forces from strategic eastern city Avdiivka

image.altText: A close-up photo of John Howard pointing to an audience, with Australian flags in the background

props.synopsis: The building blocks for a reconstruction of the political debate seem to be there — if there are willing takers who want to flesh out and examine these ideas, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The widespread delusion that obscures what's at the heart of all real politics

image.altText: A besuited man with eyes downcast exits through a sliding glass door

props.synopsis: Sitting MP Ian Goodenough has lost Liberal preselection to former Stirling MP Vince Connelly, marking the second time in a week a Liberal incumbent has failed to become the party's preferred candidate.

title.children: Liberal MP Ian Goodenough warns of 'civil war' after losing Moore preselection, considers independent run

image.altText: person looking out into ocean

props.synopsis: An alleged conversion therapy event divided this country town, but despite promises to outlaw the practice, it's still legal in this state.

title.children: 'They tell you you're worthless, then tell you they can help you': The 'harmful' practice still legal despite promised ban

image.altText: An SA Police logo.

props.synopsis: A staff member from a primary school in Adelaide is arrested and charged with "two counts of aggravated indecent assault involving a child", education authorities have said.

title.children: Adelaide primary school staff member charged with indecent assault of child

image.altText: A photo album of images of a boy, and a grown man

props.synopsis: John Steen tried to get his abuser – a priest – away from children. Instead, there was a cover-up, a confidential settlement and misrepresentations. Thirty years later, the church has been ordered to pay him $2.4 million.

title.children: John wanted justice. Instead, bishops hid files in a garage. Now the church must pay him $2.4 million

image.altText: An H3 rocket lifts off at Tanegashima Space Center in Kagoshima, southern Japan.

props.synopsis: The launch further enhances the country's space credentials, following the historic "pinpoint" moon landing of Japan's SLIM spacecraft last month.

title.children: After initial failure, Japan successfully launches new H3 space rocket

image.altText: A satellite image of flattened ground

props.synopsis: Egypt is warning Israel not to forcibly expel the more than one million displaced Palestinians now in Rafah into its territory.

title.children: Egypt building wall along Gaza border, satellite images suggest

image.altText: Twisted metal transmission towers under a grey sky.

props.synopsis: AusNet says power was restored to another 7,000 homes affected by Tuesday's electricity outage, but 15,000 properties in the Gippsland area remain cut off and some may not be back on the network for several days.

title.children: Power restored to more Victorian homes but thousands remain without electricity

image.altText: A man standing in shadows in front of a building, with light under his face at night

props.synopsis: As true-crime documentaries and podcasts flood our playlists, real-life ghost tours are capturing our imagination and gaining momentum. It turns out, we love being scared.

title.children: True-crime tours are gaining traction with tales from Jack the Ripper to gold-theft murder scandals

image.altText: A young blonde woman grins while holding the brim of her baseball cap

props.synopsis: The parents of murdered woman Gabby Petito's fiance received a "frantic" phone call from him after her death, new documents reveal.

title.children: Gabby Petito's murder drew global attention — new documents reveal what her fiance's parents say happened

image.altText: Jordan Spieth holds a club in his right hand during a 2024 US PGA Tour event.

props.synopsis: Jordan Spieth, a three-time major winner, commits an embarrassing career-first mistake after 263 starts on the US PGA Tour, while Jason Day is in contention at the Riviera Country Club in California.

title.children: Former world number one Spieth disqualified from US tournament after rookie error

image.altText: Black and white wedding photo of murder victim Kelly Wilkinson smiling.

props.synopsis: An investigation into Gold Coast mother Kelly Wilkinson's murder will be officially opened  to see if her death could have been prevented.

title.children: Kelly Wilkinson's murder to be investigated for 'systemic flaws' after ex-husband's guilty plea

image.altText: A man sitting in the driver's seat of car with his right hand on the wheel

props.synopsis: The horrific death toll on Victoria's roads last year has seen young driver safety awareness brought into renewed focus, and for some it stems from comprehensive driver education in schools.

title.children: As Victoria reels from an alarming 2023 road toll, some are seeking a solution in schools

image.altText: People gather at a temple fair amid Lunar New Year celebrations in Beijing, China February 11, 2024.

props.synopsis: For some young Asians, Lunar New Year isn't as rosy and celebratory as many people believe. It's also a time when they are grilled by parents, grandparents, uncles and aunties about why they're not married yet, or if they are married, why they don't have children yet.

title.children: These are the uncomfortable questions that many young Asians brace themselves for during Lunar New Year

image.altText: An open laptop is seen over the shoulder of a man typing. The screen shows text reading INTRODUCING CHATGPT

props.synopsis: Could you spot a news article written by a chatbot? Generative AI is changing the way we make, access and share information, and reshaping the future of journalism.

title.children: How deepfakes gave rise rise to the 'liar's dividend' and troubling questions over what's real on the internet

image.altText: Fence with a danger asbestos sign at the Rozelle Parklands as the clean up continues

props.synopsis: Many sites across Sydney remain cordoned off for testing to check the potentially asbestos contaminated mulch, and the list of sites is growing longer, but authorities say the risk from undisturbed material remains low.

title.children: Bonded asbestos found at second school, safety of students NSW government's 'number one priority', minister says

image.altText: Britain's Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex visits the Whistler Sliding Centre in Canada.

props.synopsis: King Charles's cancer diagnosis could bring the British royal family closer, Prince Harry says, adding that he loved his family and was grateful to have recently seen his father.

title.children: 'I love my family': Prince Harry says he is hopeful King Charles's cancer could bring royal family closer

image.altText: Ex-Lincoln 840am Sat

props.synopsis: Heavy rainfall and strong winds are forecast across parts of the Northern Territory as ex-Tropical Cyclone Lincoln tracks further inland, according to the Bureau of Meteorology.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Lincoln moves west over northern Australia, as heavy rainfall continues

image.altText: Liam Moffitt dressed in bright red helmet, custom-made firefighting uniform, holding trauma teddy

props.synopsis: Liam Moffitt wants to visit as many of the 334 Fire and Rescue stations in New South Wales as he can as part of a fundraising mission for burns survivors.

title.children: 4yo aspiring firefighter 'walks into station like he owns it' on 85th station visit

image.altText: An 80's boom box radio sits at the front of the image. A person lies on their back behind it with one foot on the stereo.

props.synopsis: The music we grew up listening to, like Happy Birthday or Twinkle Twinkle Little Star, can touch us in powerful ways. Neuroscience explains why we're unlikely to forget these simple songs even as we age.

title.children: Will we ever forget how to sing Happy Birthday? Researchers think it’s unlikely, even as we get older

image.altText: A group of smiling young folk pose for a fun group shot near orange and black torii gates on a hill in rural Japan.

props.synopsis: The pandemic transformed living as a digital nomad from an influencer-fuelled fantasy to a liveable reality, and Japan is the latest country in Asia to offer a way in for foreign workers, but how much it will help the aging country that's facing economic woes?

title.children: Sick of office politics? Japan's new digital nomad visa may be your way out
